glsa.title: chmlib, KchmViewer: Stack-based buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: chmlib and KchmViewer contain a buffer overflow vulnerability which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: chmlib is a library for dealing with Microsoft ITSS and CHM format files. KchmViewer is a CHM viewer that includes its own copy of the chmlib library.

description.p: Sven Tantau reported about a buffer overflow vulnerability in chmlib. The function "_chm_decompress_block()" does not properly perform boundary checking, resulting in a stack-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: By convincing a user to open a specially crafted ITSS or CHM file, using KchmViewer or a program makes use of chmlib, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the software.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
